website_summaries.verdict: A first-rate ergonomic stool that will look and perform great in a home or office setting.
pros: Equipped with four rolling wheels so the stool can easily be maneuvered
Cushion is constructed from 100% recycled foam that delivers immense softness and support
Offers twice the cushioning of comparable stools
Allows a person to sit comfortably without sinking through the cushion
cons: Casters are poorly constructed and won't necessarily grip wood floors to roll

website_summaries.verdict: Excellent value considering all it has to offer: thick padding, adjustable design, precise angles for nearly every size, reasonable price.
pros: Features and price beat out competitors
Adjustable and comfortable for most users, and price falls on the lower end of the spectrum
cons: Though it has ample padding, some owners wish the upholstery were a bit more durable (some reports of it ripping)
The wheels don't move very well

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit for short people
customer_reviews.text: I love these types of chairs because I get lower back problems from sitting to long in the standard office chairs. However, the design of this particular version really sucks for short people. I am 5'4" and the gap between seat and kneeling pad is too wide, even when at lowest setting. Shame.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron C

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and versatile with very adjustable height
customer_reviews.text: This product has a key feature that is missed in the description, it goes HIGH. The base sitting level is around 20"-21" but when adjusting the height it goes as high as about 29.5". This makes this product very versatile. I am currently using it in my office and shop for both standard desk work and work bench level work. It is a very new style of sitting for me and I am still adjusting. My back feels great but there some soreness in my shins. I chalk it up to needing to adjust the chair and my sitting posture until we find that comfy spot for long term sitting.
customer_reviews.author: pjah73

customer_reviews.title: but not great. I am 5'6 and it does not fit ...
customer_reviews.text: After using this chair for four months, I feel I am ready to provide an opinion now. This knee chair is ok, but not great. I am 5'6 and it does not fit very well. If you are my height or shorter I would seriously consider another style. The problem one's height poses is to get your knees to rest on the pad, you have to sit on the edge of the chair; this becomes quite uncomfortable on the butt relatively quickly. I find myself sitting more with my feet on the knee pad due to my knees starting to ache. My other issue is the construction of the chair allows it to wobble side to side quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: I like it so far
customer_reviews.text: I like it so far, but it's a little too high as compared to the regular chair. So to fit my regular kitchen table I actually had to remove the wheels. You can see it on photo that without wheels it's on the same level as a regular chair.
customer_reviews.author: Alexey Chekulaev

customer_reviews.title: Amaze-balls
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! I spend > 10 hours a day in front of computer and have been trying various techniques to mitigate the effects of such a sedentary lifestyle. Even in a short period of time, this chair has significantly helped my posture when I'm spending long days in front of computer. I was always keenly aware of myself when I started slouching and slumping over in my regular chair, but it was just self-awareness - I didn't really do anything about it when I started to slouch. In this chair it's much harder to move into one of those slouchy positions that end up being torture on the back at the end of the day. Only wish I'd gotten it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Great product, can get uncomfortable after long use
customer_reviews.text: This has been really helpful for my back and is super easy to use and put together. My only complaint would be that the cushion for your knees doesn’t provide a ton of support for your body. I’m fairly light @ 140 and I feel my knees pressing against the metal underneath the cushion after extended periods of sitting. This can be painful and I imagine would be more so for someone who weighs a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So glad I got this chair
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put together. I put it together by myself in 10 mins. So far it has made an almost immediate difference in back and shoulder pain. I don't even notice that I am sitting straight up. Honestly I have more energy to move around due to less pain since using this chair. It has even helped alleviate my hip pain. Very thankful.
customer_reviews.author: Tofurious

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I like that it enables me to sit in a lot of different ways. I can use it as a stool, kneel on it (of course), or sit cross-legged. My posture is generally better with it, but for some reason, it's hard to sit still for a long time. (Maybe that's good, it does encourage me to stand and take breaks.) I'm not sure if it really fits me quite right. Also, it makes my butt a little sore after a while. For the cost, I wish the cushion was a little more memory foam-like. Overall I'm happy with the purchase, it's just not absolutely perfect for me personally.
customer_reviews.author: Christa Keizer

customer_reviews.title: Helps with lower back pain!
customer_reviews.text: I have three compression fractures in my L3, L4, and L5...add sciatica in on top of that, and it’s a recipe for massive pain. This kneeling chair has made a complete change in my workday! I sit at my desk an average of 12-14 hours per day. Other reviews talked about their knees or shins hurting. I only had initial knee/shin discomfort (it wasn’t bad) for the first three days. I got up every hour for a few minutes to allow my body time to adjust to the kneeling chair, and it worked perfectly. This chair is a life saver, and I couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: J. Munafo

customer_reviews.title: Chair is too high for me, but the merchant service is exemplary.
customer_reviews.text: I am using it, but reluctantly. First off, this chair is way too high. I have a normal size desk, and I have to look down on the computer at that height. It defeats the purpose, as I can't maintain good posture that way. I am sitting on the knee rest, and use the seat as my back support. Only then the height is manageable. Also, the packaging was really bad. The foam stuck to the seat cushion, and I just can't get rid of the stain. *** Update 8/23/2017 *** Upon reading my review here, the merchant fully refunded the item without any request for refund on my part. I really appreciate the proactiveness of the merchant.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Yu

customer_reviews.title: Takes a while to get used to
customer_reviews.text: I'm on it right now. I am comfortable so it is better than the traditional $300 desk chair it replaced. The body doesn't naturally find the best position for this chair like I had wished. It's a lot like sitting on a stool and I have to remember to tuck my legs back. What's awesome as it promotes stretching the back and it would be hard to convince me this position is bad for my posture, general health. Some cons: The cushions are supported by 2 or 4 screws and will not hold up to rocking, hopping, whatever. Also, men may find some discomfort in bean bag area.
customer_reviews.author: Rockytop

customer_reviews.title: Easy-to-assemble, comfy, posture correcting kneeling chair
customer_reviews.text: I needed a chair to help me maintain good posture while seated for health reasons. This chair is easy to assemble, all hex wrenches included. The cushions have been comfy, no different from standard chairs. The seat is definitely angled forwards and tips me forward to the kneeling position. The angle is not steep but it is definitely angled. I sit for hours in an office and the chair has been comfortable and I am maintaining spine alignment by using it. It does take a little time to get used to the different seating position. It is performing well, doing what it is supposed to do and was reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Kate F

customer_reviews.title: Love this Ergonomic Kneeling Chair!
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair! Has helped me considerably with my posture as well as reduced my back, shoulder, wrist pain. I have carpel tunel in my wrists, tendinitis in both elbows, and shoulder issues/pain. It is sometimes hard on my knees, but it's very easy to adjust the way I'm sitting to reduce this. Love this chair! I work from home 8-10 hours 5 days a week. This chair has made a big difference for me!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: It’s Nice-just not for me
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out the directions, it went together really well. The directions aren’t hard, just took me a moment to figure out. The foam is nice and thick, but it is stiff. Over the long run, this will be good as it will hold up longer, but for now my shins are in pain. The chair is well made, feels very sturdy, and the adjustability is nice. Maybe the kneeling chairs just aren’t as great for me as I remembered them being.
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chair !
customer_reviews.text: not too hard to assemble, and very comfortable. I have been using it for a few hours a day with no problems. I think it does improve my posture and allows me to be a bit lower than on a chair so computer work requires less neck strain. I used to sit on a ball, which was also better than a chair. The pads are quite comfortable . It also does not mar my tiles with black marks, which I appreciate too. A very good product, well made and solid. No wobbling , no issues. I am glad to have it.
customer_reviews.author: ChristineS

customer_reviews.title: Great for lower back - savior, but knee pad going flat
customer_reviews.text: The chair saved me. I can "sit" in it for hours. With my current acute back situation, I can only sit "normally" for 10 minutes. But I may have to return this and try a different brand. The knee pad is going "flat". I know I've been using it for 5-8 hours per day, but it has only been a few weeks. Was very comfortable, but is now getting "hard" on the knees. Will update when I decide what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M

customer_reviews.title: I am normal sized, and the seat and knee ...
customer_reviews.text: I am normal sized, and the seat and knee pads are extremely uncomfortable. They are at the wrong angles. My shins are in pain. The workmanship is shoddy -- cheap Chinese production. The adjustment shaft I expect to fail at sometime, especially if I extend the seat higher. I am comparing this to a kneeling chair I had for 17 years, a very well-made Canadian product (which regrettably is not made any longer.) I will give this Chinese chair a little more time to see if its padding will conform to my bottom and legs. It is a hassle to return something.
customer_reviews.author: AkF

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CHAIR - EVEN BETTER COMPANY!
customer_reviews.text: I adore this chair! I have a big comfy desk chair but now that I work from home 100% of the time (thanks COVID) I needed a chair that was more ergonomic. This fits the bill. It was super easy to put together - taking me less than 10 minutes solo. I cannot say enough good things. The padding is plentiful and I love that I can adjust the chair - I'm short. That helps a bunch for my comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Leona Hamrick

customer_reviews.title: A great seat gives Supports energy at work!
customer_reviews.text: In my traditional office, I never thought I would have considered an ergonomic chair. I happen to be at my beauty salon recently and they had this chair in there waiting area. I found it so comfortable that I immediately purchased one to use at my desk at work each day. It instantly put my body into proper alignment and it is very comfortable. I am truly enjoying sitting at my desk in front of clients or typing on my computer with such a comfortable seat. In my traditional wing back, leather business chair, I found that I Slumped all the time. Now I am sitting up with my back unsupported and feel energized.
customer_reviews.author: Dooks

customer_reviews.title: Not the best.
customer_reviews.text: I tried the product for a good month before realizing I was developing back issues. I wanted to get this to relieve pressure off of my knees (lots of leg crossing and indian style sitting) and maintain good posture, but eventually using this kneeling chair caused me so much back pain, I was having issues making it through the day. Tried all the different sizes, and none worked. Back to the old computer chair, and the kneeling chair is my new foot rest.. so.. $120 win?
customer_reviews.author: TerraMizu

customer_reviews.title: If your tall don't consider buying it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would be a wise investment, maybe more ergonomic. I put it together sat down, and immediately regretted my purchase. Its hardly ergonomic, its straight up uncomfortable to sit on, and then I figured out that its not really made for tall guys like me. The whole "ergonomic" thing is particularly wrong too, its just a different design, and a lot of people don't actually have more luck with these over other designs.
customer_reviews.author: yarimyjeezsun

customer_reviews.title: A useful alternative to sitting!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this chair for a short period but it's a nice alternative to traditional chairs. In addition to opening up the hip flexors, it's high enough that I have a better angle for my arms. Plus, you can lock the wheels and drape your legs forward almost like a regular chair but with much less hip flexion. I like to shift between this and standing with a high counter top so my hamstrings don't get too tight. In terms of quality, I think it's fairly priced. It seems like it will be durable and it was easy to assemble. The customer service was also very attentive with an issue I had with one of the cushions.
customer_reviews.author: Gumbeval

customer_reviews.title: The seat is not aligned the same as these chairs generally are so it put a LOT of pressure on my shins
customer_reviews.text: The seat is not aligned the same as these chairs generally are so it put a LOT of pressure on my shins, I have returned it and purchased a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for this short person
customer_reviews.text: I’m a female who is only 5’ 3.5” in height, and it works just fine for me. Definitely helping my posture and back as described. I think women have longer legs, so that may be why it was okay for me. The seat isn’t as tilted as other brands on the lower setting, but it does tilt some when raised up with the height adjuster. There are also video directions, both for assembly and use, which is nice. My only complaint is that my seat came with a tear in the fake leather cover as pictured. Otherwise, for the price, I can’t complain.
customer_reviews.author: Lafter The Fact

customer_reviews.text: I am not 100% sure whether I made the right choice by buying this chair, but it does can be used in a versatile way. I am 6'2" so I don't think it is keeping my back straight by just having the kneeling pose in this chair. It needs constant correction by yourself on your posture to achieve it. I would say this chair cannot be the problem-solver on its own as the user has to put constant efforts as well. And what the heck it is cheaper now than the price I gotit for a few months ago!
customer_reviews.author: Jega Pandi

customer_reviews.title: I like the chair for the most part
customer_reviews.text: I like the chair for the most part. Its pretty tall though, I have it all the way down, and my monitors raised as high as they can go, with an extra 4-5 inches boosted bellow the base. I've only had the chair for about a month and the wheels are starting to give out though, I'm hoping that the company will see this and help me out. The wheels have stopped rotating freely and it they just sort of snag when i try to turn one way or the other, as if i used the wheel locks.
customer_reviews.author: Julee Richardson

customer_reviews.title: It's nice to have more options how to sit than in ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this chair for a month now. It's nice to have more options how to sit than in an office chair, but there are still some grievances I have with this one. For one, I still feel myself slouching sometimes. It's definitely not as pronounced as when I had an office chair, but it still happens. Two, the chair is too high for my desk, and my desk is 29.5 inches tall. I end up leaning forwards a lot and resting on my elbows, which eventually ache from the continued pressure. Other than that, the chair is a nice break.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Frost

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: The construction is sad at best. The rear left wheel falls out multiple times a day. The whole it goes in is very sloppy now and getting worse each time it comes out. The height adjustment just does not work by hand. I have used the same kind of chair I paid a lot less for from Walmart that did not look as good but worked and did not fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Roy McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Give it 4 weeks, and you'll love it.
customer_reviews.text: After 4 weeks with this kneeling chair, I am hooked. I must say that the first week was brutal, My shins were screaming in pain. I read the manual and it said to swap between a regular chair and this one, allowing for a break-in period for your shins. After about 2 weeks, my shins stopped aching and soon I forgot I was not swapping out the regular chair with this one. At this point this kneeling chair is an integral part of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P. Conroy

customer_reviews.title: who has a bad back, was very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived on time, in pristine condition, on a Saturday, delivered with a wave and smile by the United States Postal Service. The product is well made, simple to install; all that is required is an allen wrench , which is supplied, and the ability to read, and discern the difference between a 5 inch long bolt, and a 3 inch long bolt. NO rocket scientists or brain surgeons need be present during assembly of this product. It was assembled in 10 minutes, and my wife, who has a bad back, was very pleased. She is currently sitting on her chair, at her computer, happy as a clam that she now has a kneeling chair.
customer_reviews.author: not my name

customer_reviews.title: Great feel. Wish it were more durable.
customer_reviews.text: I love the design of the chair and have used it at my desk job since I got it back in February. Its comfortable for someone over 6' tall, which is uncommon, and it's been great at relieving back strain compared to typical desk chairs. Unfortunately one of the wheels bent itself out of the frame out of the blue yesterday, and it's now unusable. I've had this for less than a year, and I'm below 200lbs, so weight should not be a factor. Theres been no unintended use of the chair, and it didnt get caught on anything. The frame also seems to have some give and loosens the bolts over time when just going through daily use.
customer_reviews.author: brandon rathbun

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy ergonomic kneeling chair.
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair! I was surprised how easy it was to assemble. The cushions are super padded which is very nice. My lower back didn't hurt at all after a nine hour day in it my shoulders were a little tired but no discomfort at all in this chair. It's solid and I highly recommend it. Don't buy a wood one but a solid one like this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair I have lumbar issues encompassing degenerative disc disease one bulging disc and a disc that herniated last year. I still shift and change positions often, but being able to sit at my desk allows me to get so much work done. My old standard desk chair caused a familiar back pain that made me scared I was going to herniate again. This however is lovely. The seat is faux leather so I would recommend a blanket over it if you're not wearing pants.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: This chair is great! Having to sit at a desk all day ...
customer_reviews.text: This chair is great! Having to sit at a desk all day every day was pretty horrible on my back (even with an adjustable standing desk) so I started looking for better ways to sit. Bought this chair thinking that even if it didn't help it would be a quick lol for the office, and we could always use another chair to roll around in. Now I use it everyday and it feels so good man. Yes, it does put pressure on your shins/knees which overtime gets uncomfortable. A few weeks in and it has gotten much better, but still noticeable. Overall, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: T. Darby

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable If You're Tall
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought the Dragonn kneeling chair but returned it after a week because I couldn't sit comfortably. I'm 6'3" and saw that this one is rated for up to 6'7". I'm happy with it so far and find that I fit much more easily than in the other style I tried. I think if you're shorter this might not be a good fit as the seat angle at the shortest setting is basically flat.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair, Great Company.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chair. I bought two for my daughter, who has a back problem. (One for work, the other for home). They make her feel much more comfortable and they reduce her back pain considerably. The chair is sturdy and well-built. I also want to comment on the customer service of Sleekform. One of the chairs had a part that prevented the chair from being assembled. We wrote to the distributor, and they sent a replacement right away. A replacement chair, not just a part. These are nice people to do business with!!! As a result, I have purchased one for myself as well.
customer_reviews.author: 2ndreconmarine

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: Im 5'9" Male Sit for 8-15 hours a day Works well for posture. I've tried several things to improve my posture and alleviate muscular pain caused by a lifting injury and prolonged sitting but this one works better than anything i've tried. I have bad posture when when i sit for extended periods of time which is what i do every day as a person who works on the web as well as a full time student. Buying this chair was a great investment. I thought I'd still want to switch and use my old chair from time to time but no, this does a good job and I'd recommend it! Its sturdy too and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie G

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable for me, but FANTASTIC customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for something to help with my back while working long hours at a desk. Unfortunately, this solution was too painful for me to use. It hurt my knees and made my legs & feet go numb even after trying various heights. I will say that the company has outstanding customer service and I would strongly support purchasing anything from this seller in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea B.

customer_reviews.title: I thought this was for pain relief!?
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure that my knees aren't supposed to hurt more! After using this product for the past three weeks, I'm not very happy with it. I can't even get on it now without my knees and shins hurting! It's not very comfortable where you place your knees. Very disappointed with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: but so far so good. It's definitely not made for shorter people so ...
customer_reviews.text: Still adjusting to this chair, but so far so good. It's definitely not made for shorter people so I have to sit on the edge of it to get the most out of it. It's sturdy and the cushion is really thick but hard so its comfy. The only thing is that I feel that it should have more of a bigger angle, but maybe that's just me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don’t recommend this chair
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this chair, the padding is too stiff and the knee rests are too close to the top part and makes your knees bend too much. Also puts all the pressure on knees and not enough on your butt. It should be angled differently to even out the weight distribution. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle P

customer_reviews.title: This chair is amazing! The main reason why I got it is ...
customer_reviews.text: This chair is amazing! The main reason why I got it is to help with mild low back pain I have experienced as a result of tight hip flexors from sitting a lot. The chair has worked wonders for this, and I have no longer been having pain since using the chair regularly! I would highly recommend this chair to anyone who does a lot of sitting. It is very comfortable, affordable, and easy to assemble. This is honestly one of the best purchases I have ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Easy to put together and much more comfortable than expected. The higher you have it raised the more the top will slant. I have it set a few inches higher than a normal chair and it has a very visible slant. As someone with a weaker core, I can feel my abs working soon after sitting in it. I work at a desk all day and use this during my work hours. I've had it for about a week and like someone else mentioned, I can't sit on it all day yet, my core tires out still.
customer_reviews.author: riittle

customer_reviews.title: Its OK but keep your chair!
customer_reviews.text: Eh, didn't do much for me. I should've returned it but now its a bit too late. I didnt want to send it back without giving it a real try to see how I would like it first but now I'm stuck with it. Hurts you knees a bit and while it does help you sit up its only good for a short time. Maybe swapping your chair out for this every now and then would work but don't expect to use it as a substitute for a chair.
customer_reviews.author: ITrob523

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stars
customer_reviews.text: The chair is perfect for my needs as an oil painter. I tend to sit for hours while working and need to sit close to my projects. It was simple to put together. It has very soft cushions. After I ordered an email was sent to me with a video showing how to put it together. I would have given it five stars but there was a blob of a black rubbery silicone substance on the bottom of the seat. It should not have been there.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Back relief, but shin killer.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it makes my back feel...but it's killer on the shins. I've had it a while, and use it pretty much every day. I've tried different things, but I just can't seem to find the right position so that my shins aren't in pain after 30 minutes or so. I also had to take the wheels off, because it sits too high...I'm 6' tall.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon W.

customer_reviews.title: It's comfortable and sturdy but almost too big for a person ...
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting the seat to angle forward a little more than this. It's comfortable and sturdy but almost too big for a person my height (5'2"). I don't really like the wheels...I'd rather it had some kind of coasting pad...I might just take the wheels off and put felt strips under the frame, which will shorten it a little too. Other than those points, which are just personal preferences really, the frame and cushions seem sturdy and supportive!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey D. Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and lots of padding on this chair!
customer_reviews.text: Love it and just what I wanted. After getting it properly adjusted and accustomed to it, it is a very comfortable chair. Just remember to adjust it to the correct height and sit on the "sitting" bones and it will be fine. If you aren't sitting on your sitting bones, your knees will hurt from all of your weight being on your knees instead of your sitting bones. There are U Tube videos on how to use a Kneeling Chair or Posture Chair. This, like any other like it, are just objects and must be used properly or you will not achieve the results you want.
customer_reviews.author: bmpvrs

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. It forces you to sit up straight and correct your posture. It is helping me to heal carpal tunnel issues I have experienced from bad posture and always slouching at my desk. It looks sleek and modern and I truly like the look and feel of it. No additional cushion necessary.
customer_reviews.author: TBE

customer_reviews.title: but works great and helps keep me from slouching
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was a little longer (I'm over 6 feet), but works great and helps keep me from slouching. Pads are working pretty well, took a 3-4 days to build my shins up using for more than a few hours but now it's very comfortable for hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: brichins

customer_reviews.title: Long legs beware
customer_reviews.text: If you have somewhat longer legs this may NOT be the chair for you. To get to a comfortable length between the seat and the knee pad so I am resting on my knees, I am to the point I have to lean over to reach my keyboard totally defeating the purpose of having the chair to help me have better desk posture. Using it at a level I can reach my keypad I am resting on my shins and apparently, shin-splints from over 30 years ago don't go away because they are raging again.
customer_reviews.author: AMY

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed. Junk.
customer_reviews.text: One of the parts was welded on improperly so the wheels stick out of the back instead of out of the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair/Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Great seating alternative. I suffer from hip arthritis and sitting for prolonged periods can be very painful. After sitting in my home office chair for as little as 15 minutes made me extremely stiff so I decided to make a change. My first stop was my local Healthy Back Store where they had a floor model similar to this that I tested. This chair is much nicer/sturdier and made of better materials--and the price was comparable. Great deal. Very happy w/my purchase. Highly recommend this chair.
customer_reviews.author: LoriWBAlex

customer_reviews.title: This great chair
customer_reviews.text: I was getting a bad shoulder from slumping in my office chair . This chair did the trick ,super comfortable, a different way of sitting more even distribution of weight . The chair is simple to build although my husband was the one that built it. It fits neatly under my desk out of sight it's solid and I'm buying another 1 . I'm 5 ft 11 female
customer_reviews.author: maxine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect chair - buying more now!
customer_reviews.text: This chair was easy to assemble and it is incredibly comfortable. I actually feel more mentally alert sitting in it and I don't have to remind myself to stop slouching. My old office chair is a costly behemoth with all sorts of adjustable bells and whistles but not as comfortable and takes up twice the space. I am going to buy 1 or 2 more if these affordable kneeling chairs for other desks in my house. They are easily rolled out of sight when not in use! My son who hates homework and desk sitting is excited to get to use it. Hopefully his enthusiasm will last!
customer_reviews.author: DFW TX

customer_reviews.title: Not for me but maybe OK for you
customer_reviews.text: This chair did not help with back pain when seated on it. Flat seat cushion (rather than inclined) resulted in too much weight and force directed in direct vertical line downward into lower spine. Some people might find the tilted-forward-seat versions of this type of chair better for them. Even those don't work for me however, because I feel too much pressure on knees. My problems with this chair are very particular to me. It seems well-built and adjustable height is a plus. This might work fine for other people.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Goldin

customer_reviews.title: Eased my back pain!
customer_reviews.text: I am grateful for my kneeling chair! I bought 2; one for the house and one for the office. I have chronic back pain. My traditional office chair perpetuates my back issues significantly. However, when I sit in the Sleekform ergo kneeling chair, my back pain is significantly reduced. I am more productive at work. The chair is comfortable and easy to assemble using the youtube instruction video. I highly recommend this chair.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: If you're under 5 foot like I am, don't get this.
customer_reviews.text: This has great quality, built sturdy, and it's cushions are comfortable, but it's not the right size for us shorties.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanna M. Herbert

customer_reviews.title: I just received my chair and have been using it ...
customer_reviews.text: I just received my chair and have been using it for 2 days. After months of lower back pain due to tight hamstrings caused by sitting for 8-10 hour at work, I already feel some relief. The chair takes some getting used to.... finding the positions that work for me.....but I am feeling confident that this will provide ongoing relief for my back.
customer_reviews.author: Brigitte Schauer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and versatile.
customer_reviews.text: This chair was easy to assemble with the aid of the video on their website. I've had it for a week and so far am adjusting fine to it. I didn't necessarily buy this chair for my posture (although it does help), but I wanted to give my hip flexors relief from a 90-degree angle because they were getting very tight and sore after long periods in a convention desk chair. I sometimes sit with my feet on the knee rest and do a lower back stretch.
customer_reviews.author: mmhartford

customer_reviews.title: Bruised my tail bone
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a few years now, purchased for work. The first while that I had it I must have sat wrong and horribly bruised my tail bone. Which if you don’t know makes life really hard! I also weigh much less than the weight limit but have seen the frame bend and the wheels are having issues. It is now a very noisy lopsided chair that I’m getting rid of.
customer_reviews.author: Brit Loken

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty extreme version of a kneeling chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty extreme version of a kneeling chair. I've used others comfortably. But this one is at such an extreme angle, that it was like kneeling and sitting on my heels. I'm only 5'4, but it felt like I was way too tall for it. I could only use it for 15-20 minutes at a time before I would experience terrible knee pain, so I returned it
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: annoying casters
customer_reviews.text: This kneeling chair is as comfortable as expected but the casters are terrible. The lock flips on its own and then the wheels drag. I tried to buy replacement casters without locks but the size of the casters is small, 1/4 inch in diameter and there doesn't seem to be any vendor that carries them. The casters feel flimsy and if anyone of any weight sat on this chair they would probably not be able to scoot around. It would be impossible to return since it's all set up so now I have to spend the money to find a kneeling chair that is more substantial and put this one on the street.
customer_reviews.author: S. Antinori

customer_reviews.title: Well built, easy to assemble, feels great on my lower back and core.
customer_reviews.text: This chair has been a game-changer for my work life. I was getting lower back pain from sitting for too long. Now I'm getting a strong core for sitting too long. Seriously, this should be the default style of office chair. I can feel myself sitting up taller when I'm in "regular" chairs now. Overall, my posture has improved, and I feel happy that I'm being kind to my body. This chair in particular is easily adjustable, feels well-built, and was easy to assemble. I recommend them to everyone now.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Native

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this chair! I'm 5' 6" and it's the perfect size for me. It's easily tweakable to make the chair seat further or closer to the knee section. It was very easy to put together...my wheels were actually already attached for some reason, so that cut even more time off of the assembly haha.
customer_reviews.author: Nikon Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service from Sleekform!
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about purchasing this chair. I was worried it would put too much strain on my knees or that my legs would cramp up. It's actually the most comfortable office chair I have sat in a long time! It did not leave me feeling crippled when I got up after long stretches at the desk. I was missing a screw in my initial package, but customer service responded in minutes to my email fixing the problem! I highly recommend Sleekform as a company! I will be purchasing a second one of these chairs for use in my office at work!
customer_reviews.author: David & Annemarie

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, poor construction... I do NOT recommend..
customer_reviews.text: Good idea, poor construction... The angles are just about as good as the Balans chair but the front crossbeam was poorly drilled and the wheel bolt does not fit well and results in a dead wheel... the lock is not on, but the poorly drilled hole angle makes the wheel not able to swivel as the other wheels do... very disappointed..
customer_reviews.author: MelaGal

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Found chair to be uncomfortable. Unable to adjust setting to be able to sit for a long period of time. While taking some pressure off my back, it is tough on the knees. Might help some but didn't help me. This is merely my experience. Others may disagree.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Anderson

customer_reviews.title: and i found being folded 90 degrees at the waist just not so comfortable anymore. i've been using this chair for a ...
customer_reviews.text: i'm 6', 165, age 51 and less flexible than i used to be. and i found being folded 90 degrees at the waist just not so comfortable anymore. i've been using this chair for a few hours a day for about 30 days, and so far it has been great. i would say best feature is the padding is thick and comfortable. the frame is metal and looks very durable. if anything were to break i would guess it would be the casters, they are a bit plasticky. even so, at this price point i would say this chair is a very good value. i got it because it was 'amazon choice'.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair was very easy to assemble by myself. The padding is not quite as cushy as I would like it, but is is comfortable for a time. I switch back and forth from this and a regular office chair with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon N Rush

customer_reviews.title: Really helpful for people who has suffered from Back pain in past
customer_reviews.text: I used to get back pain while sitting on regular chair, but not on this one. First i cant see on this chair longer than an Hour so it pushes me to stand. But i sometimes sit more than an hour but my back doesnt complain as it used to do by sitting just for 20 mins on a regular chair.
customer_reviews.author: Jaya Dwivedi

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I have a new job that requires me sitting for very long periods of time. I say that because my previous job required standing for 8 to 10 hours. I knew a typical office chair would not be beneficial; so this was my other option. I have to say this kneeling chair is the perfect fix. I ordered a 2nd for my husband who really liked mine. There was a problem with the 2nd and SLEEKFORM did not hesitate to correct it. Great product and customer services!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: My lower back is pretty much pain-free on the days I use this kneeling ...
customer_reviews.text: My lower back is pretty much pain-free on the days I use this kneeling chair. The seat is quite comfortable, and the cushion my knees press into absorbs my weight, so my knees don't hurt at all. I'm short (5'5"), but that doesn't seem to make any difference in my ability to get the most out of this chair. It works best when I limit my time sitting in it to two hours (with breaks during those periods to get up and stretch). Plus, customer service has been proactive and accommodating.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Good quality chair
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this chair for about four months now. I weigh about 176, so I'm no tiny girl. I've found the quality of the chair to be good, the cushions are firm and good quality, and it has help to lessen my hip and back pain, not to mention improve my posture while working. I've found it to be a great product.
customer_reviews.author: D. King

customer_reviews.title: A great kneeling chair.
customer_reviews.text: This kneeling chair works like it should, and is very solid. I'm using it on carpet so I haven't put the wheels in yet. Assembly is easy. Try a few different heights to find the one that works well for you. I'm using this for the purpose of helping me sit in a way that does not contribute to sciatica pain. This chair is solid, and it fits under the desk. It does take a while to get used to the pressure on your knees/shins, but if you make sure to move periodically, and sit in different positions, it isn't bad. It certainly feels better overall than a traditional computer chair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Relieves Back Pain
customer_reviews.text: Chair was easy to assemble and is as advertised. It does relieve back pain, I have a ruptured disk in L4/L5. But it also puts weight on your shins which causes pain as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark LaCour

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE chair
customer_reviews.text: I suffer if lower back pain and I have use a similar chair before. I was looking forward having this chair for my home office. After assemble it I realized the upper part has no incline, which makes you sit in a very uncomfortable position to not hurt your legs. The other models I've use have an incline that offer a true ergonomic fit. TERRIBLE chair
customer_reviews.author: A Sup

customer_reviews.title: Hurts to use!
customer_reviews.text: I liked it for a few days, then my shins started to hurt! And then my bottom just couldn't handle it anymore. It's a very tough material. I'm afraid I can't even sell it. I pity the poor person who will buy it. I'll be donating this someday.
customer_reviews.author: meome

customer_reviews.title: Bad condition out of box.
customer_reviews.text: For a chair this expensive you would expect that it would be in good condition. Parts "b and c" which is how its labeled in the instructions; are scraped up and its not just the paint, but the metal itself. Part C has an end cap piece which is completely crushed and the other end cap is deformed as if they shoved them on their cause they wouldn't fit. Part E which is the cushion you place your knees on has silver paint on it. Ordered many things on amazon, but this is one of about two items ever that I have been dissatisfied with.
customer_reviews.author: Zer0

customer_reviews.title: Not easy/ Limited adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Assembles easily. But the mechanism to adjust the height of the seat is difficult to adjust. (It is hard to turn the metal ring) I expected a hydraulic lever.
customer_reviews.author: Amy's Army

customer_reviews.title: Great support, perfect pads, not so great casters
customer_reviews.text: I really like this chair. I borrowed another from a friend and the seat was too soft and I found myself sliding. This chair is soft enough to give in the seat and shin pads, but still firm enough to hold me in place. The reason I didn't give it 5 stars is only because the casters seem cheap. Not sure how long they will hold up. And they don't move nearly as well as I would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Lovnthecaps

customer_reviews.title: It's much bigger than you are expecting.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good chair for people with problems with their backs. I have bad posture and this chair helps me to keep my back straight while I'm working on my table. I didn't expect it to be so huge and heavy, to be honest but it seems it's doing its job!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Not for anyone over 6'
customer_reviews.text: While the padding on the kneeling chair is adequate, I purchased this kneeling chair as the ad states the size rating up to 6'6". I am 6'3". I can tell you without a doubt that there is not enough adjustment in the height such that pressure is not on my lower shin. While this chair may be adequate for someone under 6', it is not for anyone over.
customer_reviews.author: The L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design, quality and comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these chairs years ago and loved it. When I needed a new computer desk chair I decided to try this one. Assembly was easy. It's very solid and comfortable. Make sure you distribute your weight properly as you sit on it...all your weight should never go in your knees. It's an excellent value for a solid seat.
customer_reviews.author: Cyntheea

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable!
customer_reviews.text: It certainly doesn't look like the picture with the gal sitting straight up. Difficult to sit down and difficult to get out of.
customer_reviews.author: john newman

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair - Excessive  Assembly
customer_reviews.text: More assembly involved than I prefer. and tried my patience. My other kneeling chairs are wood, with doweling and shipped assembled. Yours is a little too large, but comfortable. I recommend for lazy people like me that you pre-assemnle parts. But it would be fun for do-it-yourselfers
customer_reviews.author: howard d

customer_reviews.title: Great chair.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair after trying and returning cheaper brands that fell apart. This one has sturdy wheels, strong frame, acceptable cushions. After 6 months use I am confident it will last. And, it has provided significant relief for my low back issues.
customer_reviews.author: chinofarmer

customer_reviews.title: Instantly felt comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Instantly felt comfortable. I type a lot for work, and the kneeling chair makes my day better. My back is straighter and it somehow naturally fit my body. My son built it for me in about 15 minutes, and showed me how it can be adjusted, but I didn;t even have to adjust it at all. Thank you for this chair. It improves my posture and therefore improves my health.
customer_reviews.author: Babs177

customer_reviews.title: "THIS IS NICE! " It is quality construction
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my friend who has back pain. She said, "THIS IS NICE!" It is quality construction. The instructions to put it together are problematic, so get a maintenance guy to do it. I am a girl and had to take it apart and put it back together three times before I figured out the little Chinese drawings. My friend who works in maintenance says this is normal and he has to do the same thing. So just hang in there. It's a beautiful kneeling chair.
customer_reviews.author: Owl

customer_reviews.title: Arrived torn
customer_reviews.text: It arrived torn. Right where you'll put your weight on the lower cushion. Also, there are places where there are sharp objects below the leather cover - I don't believe it will survive much. It's my fault I only opened it now (moved house and life happened...), but it arrived defective. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: DonnerJack

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable... if you don't cheat
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly comfortable and easy to assemble. Just resist the urge to return to old habits and sit on it wrong (feet on the floor or on the knee pad) or to put it too far from your desk and lean forward, ruining its benefits.
customer_reviews.author: Beef Rocksteak

customer_reviews.title: It's like sitting on a stool
customer_reviews.text: Product when used at a normal desk, and in the right height, the top seat is almost horizontal. It's like sitting on a stool. When angled to help keep your back straight, you are way to high up. Not comfortable
customer_reviews.author: rathdean

customer_reviews.title: Wheel fell off after 6months
customer_reviews.text: I really liked everything about this chair, until the wheel fell off at 6months. I think a chair should last longer than that.
customer_reviews.author: MaryContrarie

customer_reviews.title: its different, but so far so good. it does as described
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. i feel immediately pressure relief off the back. ive only had it for a few days so im not sure if after some time it will pressure my knees or not. time will tell. i suppose i could always switch back and forth to a regular chair if it became an issue. chair is solid/sturdy and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS COTTONE

customer_reviews.title: Should have brought this sooner!!!
customer_reviews.text: Keep your back straight and core strong! Allows my body to sit in a very comfortable but correctly aligned position. My neck and shoulders no longer hurt and ache all night after a long day at the office!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy & Michael

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by how comfy this chair is. Well padded. Takes a few “sits” to get used to. I don’t have specific back problems but tend to slouch. This chair seems to help with that.
customer_reviews.author: bettyhepp

customer_reviews.title: Rotten design
customer_reviews.text: The seat angle cannot be adjusted independently. The only way to get the angle comfortable for the buttocks is to lower the seat causing extreme flexion of the knees and if you didn't have swollen ankles and varicose veins before you will get them now - and maybe blood clots too. The pressure on the shins is only tolerable for about ten minutes plus the covering does not breathe so the pressure spots sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Lewans

customer_reviews.title: Back pain relieved
customer_reviews.text: I do love this chair, once my body has adjusted to the new "sitting" after sitting in a normal office chair for years. This helps my lower back and once my legs get stronger will help in the newly adjust sitting
customer_reviews.author: grace

customer_reviews.title: Assembly directions were easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: Assembly directions were easy to follow, so far the chair seems to be well made although the locking wheels tend to lock themselves which makes moving tougher. in my situation having locking wheels is no benefit nor needed. I find the cushions for knees as well as rump sufficient, but I do find that I slouch as easy in this chair as in my regular office chair.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Rough on leg circulation if desk is not adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the seat is uncomfortable. Needs to conform to the butt and not cut off leg circulation. Update: The company is very responsive and refunded me money when they didn't need to. I would like if the seat and knee pads were adjustable for better angle. Cushioning is great.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Waldron

product_meta.title: SLEEKFORM Kneeling Chair Height Adjustable for Office & Home | Ergonomic Posture Corrective Seat | Knee Stool for Bad Back Support, Neck Pain & Spine Relief | Orthopedic Faux Leather Knees Cushions
feature_bullets: [REDUCE PAIN] The Atlanta positions you with an open hip angle that encourages an upright posture. This will align your back, shoulders and neck.

[ADJUSTABLE] This adjustability of the seat angle (91°-117°) will allow you to find the perfect position that fits your specific needs. It’s ideal for people 5’2”-6’6” with a height adjustment range 21”-28”.
[VERSATILE] The Atlanta is perfect for meditation, computer work or gaming, a sewing or crafting chair or a posture correcting chair and holds up to 265 lbs of weight.

[IMPROVED WHEELS] This chair comes with 2”universal castor wheels, allowing them to be replaced or switched out whenever you need. It can easily be moved through your space while protecting all types of flooring.
[COMFORT] The 4” thick cushions allow you to sit comfortably without sinking through the cushion. All of our cushions are made from 100 percent recycled foam.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars765 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
